DOC.HEAD: London Stocks Sharply Higher at Midday
DOC.TEXT: Stocks in London were sharply higher at midday Wednesday, boosted by Wall Street's recovery on Tuesday. At about noon in London, the Financial Times-Stock Exchange 100-share index was up 20.8 points, or 0.9 percent, at 2,362.9 points. The market received additional impetus from the release of British money supply data for November, which showed that the government efforts to keep a tight grip on Britain's money supply may be succeeding. The market was also led forward earlier in the day by the end December Financial Times-Stock Exchange futures contract, which at one point showed a 10-point premium to the underlying market. Volume came to a healthy 353.4 million shares by midday compared with 357.6 million shares at the same time Tuesday.
